The length was too short. I raise my hands and the it comes almost above my belly button. I bought another shirt at the same time. Fits great. Not sure if it was made improperly or that is the style for this shirt. I will be returning it.

review.reviewBody: Great top on a warm day. The colors are ideal, matches with my other Free Fly bottoms. Will definitely be getting more T-shirts. I bought a large and it fits perfect, usually unisex large is a bit too big. I ordered a large because I wanted it to be comfortable when I travel, but not unkept. This works

description: Buy the Hyperlite Mountain Gear Southwest 40L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Southwest 40L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hyperlite Mountain Gear Southwest 40L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I use this pack for everything. It is the most comfortable and versatile pack I have ever had. Planning to have this forever!
review.name: My Favorite Piece of Gear

review.reviewBody: I have used this several time.  I initially bought it as a day pack but it had turned into my multi day pack.   It’s comfortable and I am able to fit everything I need for a multi day hike.
review.name: Great light pack.

review.reviewBody:
Bought this as my first pack. Really like the weight, material durability, design and simplicity.

Took it on a 25 mile/2-day trip and really got to learn how to adjust it to be comfortable for my self. Despite its simplicity there are a surprising amount of ways to get the weight adjusted and fit to your body and liking. Unfortunately Hyperlite doesn?t really seem to have any in-depth instruction on guidance on how to do this beyond their basic sizing  instruction. But it wasn?t hard to figure out either while on the trail. Perhaps the best place to test and adjust anyway.
review.name: Love this pack

name: Southwest 40L Backpack

description: Buy the Reima Vantti Softshell Jacket - Girls' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vantti Softshell Jacket - Girls'
hasVariant.description: Buy the Reima Vantti Softshell Jacket - Girls' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Loved the jacket but had to return it for a bigger size :(
review.name: Spring jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket is just perfect. I’m buying this jacket for a friends’ child. My son already has one and I’m about to buy one more in other colour. It’s very high quality and very durable. The old one my 7-years son has it’s almost as new. I would strongly recommend this jacket for autumn, lighter winters and spring time. My kiddo loves it and wears it all the time! Thank you Reima!
review.name: Wonderful jacket!

review.reviewBody: This is the highest quality most unique item I have seen for kids. With this jacket on... bring on the weather. Rain, Cold, Snow, no matter the conditions this tough jacket will keep them dry and happy.
review.name: Best Kids light weight coat.

review.reviewBody: This jacket fits my slim build son perfectly- size 122; 48lbs, almost 7 years old and on the tall side. It keeps him dry, allows him to move and is super cute. We love it. It is good quality and keeps up on all of our adventures.
review.name: Great all around outer layer

review.reviewBody: Really liked the feel of this jacket. Soft, slightly stretchy and slim fitting. However we didn't keep it as I felt like it ran small or perhaps true to size and wouldn't be easy for my preschooler to get on/off independently while wearing layers at his outdoor school. Would be a great spring coat with 1 shirt underneath but this coat was a recipe for 'my sweater sleeves are bunched up' tantrums in our young child.
review.name: Stylish and slim fitting. Not great for layers

review.reviewBody: The size was a little snug for my two year old but a really fantastic mid season jacket
review.name: The size was a little

review.reviewBody: These are great pants and so far seem to be very durable and high quality. My toddler is in outdoor preschool so they get a lot of wear in wet conditions. They have proved to be waterproof. Sometimes they are completely soaked but the inside is still fairly dry. I'm satisfied! The only issue I experienced with this particular item is the sizing seems to be off. My son is 4 years old and I usually order that size in this brand due to Reima's extra sizing for growth. That was not the case for this jacket. I had to go up 2 sizes to a 6 y/o and I'm doubtful he will be able to wear it another season.
review.name: Perfect for fall and wet conditions!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We love our Reima jackets. Sizing is consistent with other products we've owned. Shipping was quick. Intentionally we bought a bright color, which comes with the added challenge of stain management for an active kiddo outside in forest school; which we anticipated but I do wish it was easier.
review.name: Great as always.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality and my grandson likes it and will stay nice and dry in the Pacific Northwest rain.
review.name: Great quality and my grandson

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the best looking kids jacket out there. I was looking for a light softshell because my son won’t keep his heavy coat on while he’s outside, so thought something lighter and more breathable would work, and this coat did the trick. He has no problem putting it on and keeping it on. And it looks and feels very high quality.
review.name: Great jacket!

name: Vantti Softshell Jacket - Girls'

review.reviewBody: These are my third pair of tele boots That I bought in 28 years of telemark skiing. I have never just bought online before and I went according to my running shoe size. These fit like a glove. So comfortable and new boots means warm boots. :)). Very happy
review.name: Scarps for life!

review.reviewBody: I tried to order this item; however, USPS held it in a "pre-shipping" limbo for six days, and then I finally got a hold of someone who sounded like they were in a call center overseas, and it was very difficult to understand what they were saying because of the background noise and thick ascent. By the end of a cycle of being put on hold multiple times, they told me they would "refund my financial institution." It saddens me to see that Backcountry has become this. They used to be the GOAT... :(
review.name: Pat M

review.reviewBody: My standby tele boots are @ 2008 Women's T'2s However over time I've developed a neuroma and my feet have spread, I now use an rx orthotic that takes up room too.  Thanks to backcountry for helping me out to try a larger size T2.  These are my impressions from both the old model and a try on of the current model.: My heels are pretty narrow and the T2 still fits the heel well but there's just not enough volume in the forefoot to accommodate the orthotics even in a size larger.  The T2 is low enough to accommodate a woman's calf and most other boots do not and overall it provides great support .  This would be a great fit for narrower and lwoer volume feet.  For a hihger volume in the forefoot try Scott.
review.name: Lower volume toe box

name: T2 Eco Telemark Boot - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The soles come loose. Bought 4 pair of keens over the last six years. Eventually the soles come loose/ off. I love the fit and feel of your shoes but you need forever adhesive on the soles. I ranted to you about this over a year ago. Still haven’t fixed your problem. Same poor answer being given to customers with same complaint.
review.name: Sole adhesive no good-no buy no more

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I currently have three pairs of Circadia boots (and one pair of the shoes). The first pair I bought was in December of 2022 from the Keen website, and I have worn them exclusively at my job in a warehouse, where I'm walking on concrete floors 9-10 hours a day. I rotate my Circadias with other Keen boots (Targhee III, Durand, Detroit), so they have not been my daily footwear for my job. Unfortunately, the sole on one of the boots (left) is completely falling apart at the toe, with several layers visible. I've never experienced this type of wear with any other Keen shoe or boot, which is all I've been wearing at work for the past 5+ years, so I can't blame it on the way I'm walking. And overall, I've worn nothing but Keen boots and shoes for probably the last 20 years or so and have also never experienced any kind of failure like this. 

Three photos attached. The worn sole of the two-year-old Cicadia, and the soles of Durand and Detroit boots, both of which I've had for over 5 years, and have warn at least five times as long on the concrete floors at my job. Not even a hint of failure with them. 

Otherwise, these boots are quite comfortable and run about a half size smaller than standard Keen boots. Hopefully the other two pair of Circadia boots and one pair of shoes last a lot longer than my first pair of Circadias.
review.name: Disappointed with sole failure

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I put them on and they felt great! Also, they were super easy to slip on and get out of later...I really like the ease of having my feet so protected.
Thank you very much for the great shoes!
review.name: Super comfortable right out of the box!

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great boot, very comfortable. Not waterproof. I got water entering the boot walking through wet lawns on a rainy day even after using a waterproofing spray on it. I suspect it’s because of the mesh spacing that allow the boot to be more flexible and comfortable.
review.name: Not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've worn KEEN boots exclusively for about 10 years. I bought these for my summer work in the forest. My wife tells me that no one is harder on their gear than me. She's probably not wrong and these boots have held up to some serious terrain and I'm still wearing them after 5 months of abuse. Great boots.
review.name: Comfort, reliability, and toughness

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for winter work boots, tried them on, fit great. Will be changing to these soon
review.name: Work boots

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are not good if you’re thinking of buying them for work purposes. I work for a landscaping company. I bought a pair and within two weeks both of the midsoles ripped off. I sent them back for an exchange and the second pair did the same exact thing.
review.name: Not good for work

review.itemreviewed: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Boots are light and super comfortable, holding up well, I used these for construction and am going through them pretty quick, but I work with asphalt,concrete,trenching, not fair for the boots🤣
review.name: Comfy

name: Circadia Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Wadi Rum Jogger Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wadi Rum Jogger Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Wadi Rum Jogger Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These pants weren't very durable, which is too bad because I loved the fit and bought them because they're described as abrasion resistant. The thread used to stitch the seams is too soft and too easily cut by any rough surface. The seams have only a single row of stitching, so if the thread is cut in one spot the pants don't hold together. I nicked the back seam on some sharp rock and they completely came apart: a double seam would have saved the day and I could have repaired them. The inner leg seam began unraveling after the first wear/wash.
review.name: Not Abrasion Resistant

review.reviewBody: Outdoor Research's sizing for bottoms is all over the place. I'm 5'8", 135lbs and it is always risky for me to order bottoms that are not specifically tall sizes, but occasionally I get lucky. For me these pants were disappointing in two specific ways: 1. Way too short, even for joggers. I had the cuffs of these pants sitting at the bottom of my calf several inches above where I would have liked them to fall at the bottom of my ankles. They were to short to look like joggers and too long to look like capris, and overall the look was very awkward. 2. The thigh area was super tight and constrictive. I can't imagine being able to climb in these and having normal mobility. I could not even squat comfortably as I stood there trying them on for the first time. The thigh area was bizarrely tight compared to the rest of the pants. One positive thing I can say is that I do like the draw cord at the waist, as the waist was very loose for a size 6 and the draw cord was nice for getting the pants snug. I don't recommend these for long legged people.
review.name: Poor fit

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these pants. They fit great and feel comfortable. Perfect for backpacking, casual wear, plus I also wear these for my nursing work at a clinic.
review.name: I love these pants

review.reviewBody: These pants  have a slimming look on me. I like the thickness and texture of the material. I do think they will be great for hiking and rock scrambling. They also work for a dinner out with a nice top.
review.name: I love these pants

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love these pants so bad. Ordered a few different sizes to try based on reviews and none worked out. I am 5'4" / 125 lbs with a somewhat athletic build and am usually a 2 or 4 in pants. The 4 wouldn't even go over my hips. The 6 was still tighter on my thighs than I would have preferred for climbing but also resulted in a huge gap at the back of the waist. There is a drawstring to tighten, but it resulted in a crazy amount of cinched fabric. Even more sad was the zippered leg pocket that I couldn't even slide my hand in to. 

These would probably work great for someone with a slimmer build. Both the Storm and Tapenade colors looked great in person and the jogger style is great.
review.name: Strange Fit

review.reviewBody: The idea is great, but the fit is pretty weird. I'm usually a snug size 6 in OR, but these have a massive gap at the back of the waistband (2+ inches; a full fist and then some). There is a drawstring, but it's not enough to keep these puppies up and snug. The crotch is also oddly long even when worn high? Too much fabric in the crotch-to-waist region. Not sure what's going on with these. They're comfortable, but I would recommend sizing down if you're 135lb, 5'6".
review.name: Runs big

review.reviewBody: Terrible fit. Super tight on thighs, loose at waist and too low cut to be practical while climbing. Cut for women shaped like rulers? Ordered size 10 and 12, 10 wouldn't get over my hips, 12 tight on thighs huge on waist. Just really bad and unflattering. This is the second time I try OR climbing pants for women and it's another fail. I'll stick to DeadBird which seems to fit my body nicely.
review.name: Terrible fit

review.reviewBody: I truly appreciate the ajustment made possible at the waist because of the lace. It allows the pant to fit better! Great!
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: I wear these to the office and for field work. They are very comfortable, I just wish they were slightly longer in the leg.I'm 5'7". They stretch out a little bit with wear, but not so much that they become baggy. the pockets are a decent size, and the fabric seems pretty durable. I haven't had any issue with them so far and I have been wearing them for several weeks.
review.name: great pants, but would like a little longer leg.

review.reviewBody: The waist and leg width fit was great, but the length is much too short. I am 6' tall, and they appear like flood pants on me. Sad to return; I love the tapenade color. OR has been great for inclusive sizing but does not have many tall options for casual pants. Dear OR, please make a longer inseam option for these pants.
review.name: short inseam

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my wife 6 months ago. She just wears the garment around town and casual. No hard use. The seams are falling apart in the front zipper area. Both sides. Poor stitching. I have several versions of this fleece, new and old. I have not had any problems. I will try to return.
review.name: Quality issues.

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace a 15 year old Mountain Hardwear Monkey Phur jacket, and I'm pleased with the new model! The loft isn't quite as high, but it has the same warmth level, it's super soft, and the cuff and bottom edge material feels more substantial/tougher than the old model. The fit is slightly more generous than the old model, which I think most people will appreciate. I liked the shorter sleeve length and overall length on the old model because I'm short, but the same size in the new model also fits well. I'd say it runs true to size. I'm 5'2" with an athletic build, and the XS fits well. And the fuchsia/pink-purpley color is amazing in person. So far it's been washed a couple times and doesn't seem to shed much. I dry it for 5 or 10 minutes then let it hang dry the rest of the way to try to keep fiber shedding to a minimum.
review.name: A super soft update to an old favorite

review.reviewBody: My husband has had this jacket (men’s version) for years and I always steal it and wear it. I finally bought one for myself and I just love it. It is so soft and so warm. And great quality.
review.name: Love this jacket!

review.reviewBody: Great Jacket, Great Price! I have had the black jacket like this for 15 years and is still in great condition.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: I have tried for years to replace my old Monkey Fleece that was accidentally ruined. Tried Ebay but all old and matted, none new. So happy I found this almost replacement. Very similar but the fleece is thinner. I dont mind as I have heavier fleeces already.
review.name: like my Old Monkey Fleece but thinner

review.reviewBody: Cognac color, classic pocket design and layering versatility.
review.name: The Best!

review.reviewBody: This is my favourite lounging hoody without the hood!  It’s so comfortable, I would recommend it to anyone!
review.name: Warm and cozy!

review.reviewBody: Runs slightly big, but extremely comfortable and warm! A great accessory for the pop of color and the pockets are amazing.
review.name: Very Pleased

review.reviewBody: Soft and cozy, but on windy days I did experience some breeze coming through. I do feel warm in it though and would still recommend it if you’re looking for a soft material jacket. I have sensory issues so fabric textures that don’t rub my skin weirdly are two thumbs up and this jacket passes the test!
review.name: Soft and cozy

review.reviewBody: This is my fav fleece of all time! Zipper pockets, warm, cozy & fluffy like a teddy bear.. what more could you ask for!? I have it in gray also.
review.name: favorite fleece!

review.reviewBody: We bought hardtail gravel bikes and soon learned what a bad idea that was. After researching several products, we ended up trying the ST, and it does the job—just enough flex without bouncing you around.
review.name: Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: Purchased this for my e-assist bike, riding some road but mostly bumpy gravel- easy to install and adjust the stiffness (comes with medium elastomer installed- soft and hard elastomers included along with weight chart and recommended elastomer); add just the right amount of absorption of bumps/dips/shocks without "bouncing"- highly recommended
review.name: excellent for road and gravel riding

review.reviewBody:
Major disappointment. This seat post does not let you adjust the angle of the seat once you install the seat on the post. In most other seatposts I've used, you can just loosen the bolts a bit, adjust the angle, and tighten them again. In older thudbusters there was even a convenient dial for adjusting the angle. Here, you have to take the seat off and disassemble the whole thing - good luck making minor adjustments.

If you do decide to buy it, first make sure you do the following before taking the old seatpost off:
- measure the angle of the seat
- measure the offset of the seat (compared to the stem or something else on the bike that you're not changing)

Only then take off the old seatpost and install this one while setting the seat angle and offset to your old spec before you tighten the bolts - you won't be able to adjust it afterwards.
review.name: Incredibly difficult to set up

name: Thudbuster ST Seatpost

review.reviewBody: I like these gloves in a lot of ways they fit well, are comfortable, I like the design, and they seem pretty durable.  Maybe I got lucky and got a good pair.  However, I have cold hands, and it is particularly problematic for my thumb and index finger tip pads (where I am pressing the shifter, dropper post remote, and brakes).  Below about 35 degrees Fahrenheit, they don't quite cut it.  Also some times my finger tips will be okay but the back of my hand will be sweaty.  Once this happens, it is very hard to get the gloves off and on as the liner comes part way out.  If I just take them off and let them dry, it is fine.  But I often report downed trees or trail damage to our local group and I need to get my phone out for pictures and map pins, and its a whole lot easier with my gloves off.  I got them in XXL and it was a bit snug, I usually wear an 11.
review.name: Not quite up for the really cold days

review.reviewBody:
I've consistently struggled with cold fingers in lower 30's temps and these gloves have definitely solved that.
I'll continue to test them through the winter, but ride #1, at 33 degrees proved to me, that these are the gloves I will wear all winter long.
review.name: Amazing so far

review.reviewBody: I have used the glove exclusively for riding my bike. I have noticed that the gloves are tearing and coming apart in at least two places. Given the price of the gloves, I needed better durability. In that sense, I feel cheated on quality. The cold weather performance is decent for short rides under 45 minutes.
review.name: Durability wanting. Now worth the price.

review.reviewBody: Great look and fit.  Have used several times for spring skiing.
review.name: Sharp pants

review.reviewBody: Has adequate room in general, except for the hips. For some reason there's an elastic strap going around the hip area; I presume this is to prevent some sagging when people fall, but annoyingly the elastic doesn't allow my hips to fit, as the rest of the pants is fine (and presumably it would fit without said elastic band). The elastic band gives it a gusseted look, which helps you have a more comfortable wearing experience, if your hips can fit.
review.name: Good but small on hips sizing

review.reviewBody: MountainHardwear-  Why did you remove my 1 Star review and also that of another user? These are a poor design of pants with an intrusive seam and poor pockets
review.name: My review was removed

review.reviewBody: No adjustments on the waist? I have never seen ski pants that don't have velcro adjusters. I like them other than that but it's a miss on something that these pants should have. Yes, a belt can help but who wants to wear a belt really?
review.name: No adjustments?

review.reviewBody:
These are a good looking very basic pair of ski pants.  the outer material is quite a bit different than I’ve seen on other mountain hardware clothes (a bit shiny). I have the golden brown pants which I get compliments on.

I deducted one star for the really crappy gators. like most mountain hardwear items the quality has gone down and lack of details gone up ever since Columbia bought them.  The gators on these pants are way too short - gators in ski pants should be at least as long as the pants themselves and even maybe even a bit longer. but these are about 4 inches shorter than the pants so they barely cover the top of a boot and when you bend down they will just pop right off. My previous mountain hardware pants had a really nice gator with a thick elastic band imprinted with mountain hardwear - the ones here are just really short generic gators with a thin elastic - clearly just done to save money.

 I also removed a star because all previous pants used to have an elastic waist adjustment with Velcro.  these do not, so you will need to buy a belt.  so even though these pants are cheap you’ll probably have to pay some money to lengthen the gators as I did and you will need to buy a belt,

Another observation is that the insulating material is quite thin - not a bad thing has thinner material is nicer on a warmer day and you can always just add a thicker base layer,  but just thought I would let you know that the insulating material is thinner than previous pants I’ve had from mountain hardwear.
review.name: good looking but very basic

review.reviewBody: Quality is good. Material will hold up to long days on the slopes, but runs small.  I'm 5"11 and 187 and bought a medium like the sizing guide suggests, but it was like trying to pull on skinny jeans. Could not even bend knees to squat down. Kind of annoying they don't do exchanges - you have to return and completely re-buy, but thats a service issue, not a quality issue. Overall they will meet at exceed my expectations now that ive got the sizing correct. Could use some sort of waist cinchers to hold on hips better, rather than need to buy a belt. Small detail.
review.name: Will Hold Up To Long Days On The Slopes

review.reviewBody: These pants are it. Very comfortable, slim in the leg and fit perfectly over your boot, water proof, and has all the features you need: crotch zips for air flow on hot days, elastic boot lining to stop snow from getting up your leg, long zipper ties for easy use with gloves, slim mid thigh pocket for phones, Velcro reinforced button. Is there anything else you need?
review.name: More than solid, all the features you need

name: Firefall 2 Insulated Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: These joggers are really good quality and good value for the amount I paid. The size (Medium) is a good fit and the joggers are very comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable and Great Fit

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and are stylish enough that the only place they are. It acceptable would be work or church
review.name: Comfortable and can be worn everywhere but work

review.reviewBody: Bought these sweatpants for my husband for Christmas. He loves them! They aren't too thick, but just enough to keep him warm. Roomy but not too baggy. Very comfy and stylish too! Will definitely buy more!
review.name: Love these sweatpants!

review.reviewBody: Just what I expected when I ordered it.  The fit is just right.  The color is as described.
review.name: Good color and fit

review.reviewBody: Fit great and extremely soft on the inside
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Fit as described and comfortable.
review.name: Great joggers

review.reviewBody: Love these sport style joggers.  They fit really well and are comfortable.  The green color is really nice!  They do fit a bit slimmer, especially down the leg toward the calf.
review.name: Awesome color

review.reviewBody: I love this fleece, so soft and not too heavy, but warm. I bought it in black, and want one in green. I was in search of a casual one to wear to work. It's stylish and not too cropped. It's also very warm and does the job! The material didn't pill after throwing it in the wash + dryer. Also, LOVE that it has a little kangaroo pouch pocket.
review.name: Stylist and Warm!

review.reviewBody: I dont normally wear pullovers bc I dont like pulling tops over my head throughout the day when I get too hot and have to take off the popover but this one is a great weight, I dont get too hot and the neck opening is so large it makes it so easy to pullover.  And I love the depth of the zipper front bc I can show a cute little printed top under it. I got the green colorway and just love it.
review.name: Great pullover

review.reviewBody: I first bought the green color and loved it so much that I immediately purchased the other 2 colorways. It's soft and cozy and just right for the fall weather. It's a nice relaxed, loose fit and super comfortable.
review.name: My Favorite Fall Top!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift for my girlfriend through Steep and Cheap. Measured her hand (giving up the surprise) for an exact fit according to Swany Sizing. It was miserably small. The inside of the glove has a rough leather patch, and is not soft or comfortable at all. It would literally chafe your fingers if you used without the lining. The finger access is difficult to use, and you can hardly use your hands with it. Will be avoiding Swany gloves.
review.name: Awful Product. Sizing is bad too

review.reviewBody: I have had these for many years and am about to buy another pair. I have autoimmune issues and my hands and body feel extremely cold faster than most people. These gloves allow me to be out on the slopes all day. I open the zipper and tuck hand warmers between the gloves and mitten. These are the warmest and most comfortable gloves I’ve ever owned.
review.name: Keep cold hands perfectly warm

review.reviewBody: I just received these mittens and the leather outer mitt is huge (although it is butter soft leather).  There is so much volume that when I cinch the wrist the fabric folds in multiple places. The inner liner fit fine, but I did not feel these mitts warranted the high price tag. Back they go...
review.name: Huge Outer Mitten...

name: Supreme Mitten - Women's

description: Buy the The North Face Yukiona Mid Winter Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Yukiona Mid Winter Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Yukiona Mid Winter Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable snow boots I've ever experienced. I've realized that they are actually the most comfortable shoe I own. I love them so much and often hike in them.
review.name: Best boot I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Yukiona Mid Boots to replace my old winter boots, and they've been a great choice! I live in Utah and use them frequently from October to April or even May. These boots are incredibly warm and keep my feet cozy during all my winter adventures. While I'm not sure if they run a bit small or if my feet have widened after pregnancy, I do feel they could be a bit roomier. One thing I would have preferred is if they were slightly lighter in weight, but they're still comfortable overall. All in all, I'm very satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend these boots to others looking for reliable winter footwear.
review.name: Warm and cozy!

review.reviewBody: These are my winter sneakers, my everyday wear. Wind, rain, or snow, I feel safe and secure in these boots. I've had these for about 7 years.. I think, along with the Northface coat which believe it or not... I've had for 15 years. No Cap!
review.name: It's Worth Your Time and Every Dime!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these boots! I just wore them in Alaska at the end of February 2024 - beginning of March and they kept my feet super warm in negative and single digit temps. I also got a ton of compliments on them from both men and women- a few men saying they wish they had them. I went with my normal size 6 and they are a solid boot! These are also my first tall snow boot purchase (even though I've lived in Colorado my whole life) and I'm super happy with them!
review.name: I love these boots! Super Warm!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent boots. Very warm and comfortable. Would buy them again.
review.name: I would buy these boots again..

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and actually waterproof. I usually wear between 8.5 and 9 and the 9 fits perfect with room for heavier socks.
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wasn't sure how I would feel about a lace up boot. I have always had a zipper boot. I absolutely love these! They are warm, and so supportive and comfortable!
review.name: Seriously meets my high boot expectations!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very happy with the boots. Fit is as expected and comfortable. Very warm.
review.name: I would buy this product again without question.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent boots! Great fit. These are by far the best boots I have ever purchased. I am very pleased.
review.name: Best Boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best investment I've made into a pair of boots. They are water proof and warm. Love them :)
review.name: I would buy them again

name: Yukiona Mid Winter Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Vision Hybrid Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vision Hybrid Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Vision Hybrid Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Vision Hybrid Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Vision Hybrid Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Length might be long for taller people. Need to buy suspenders.
review.name: Needs belt loops

review.reviewBody: Surprised with how much I like these. Versatility and super light. I wear them down to 0 F without under layer for dog walks (up to 30s F). Too warm for running/xc skiing and most aerobic exercise outside of extreme cold. . . but awesome for camp/nights when touring. Great for chairlift skiing under shell pants. I have a 32in waist and 30in inseam and medium fits great. Highly recommend.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: I use it at hiking and it just did a very good job. Warm , comfortable elastic waist band, and water repellent.
review.name: Warm outer layer

review.reviewBody: The fit is good. I wish there were belt loops or a drawstring.
review.name: Comfortable pants

review.reviewBody: Great pants for what they are. Warm and great for belaying in the cold. Packs small but the fabric seems quite fragile which is to be expected given its 20D. Would personally prefer higher durability fabric in the seat and knees to improve durability but that just personal preference. For the function these are supposed to serve they’re about as good as you could ask. I ordered a small in akin to other black Diamond pants/shorts I’ve owned and it fits perfect and I can even wear pants under if I’m throwing these on to belay between climbs.
review.name: Warm yet fragile

review.reviewBody: I was one the hunt for a pant to wear all winter while walking the dog. Black Diamond is the best!
review.name: Perfect Single Layer Pant

review.reviewBody: These pants are warm, flexible, and feel great.  Somehow they breathe too.  Truly seem like something from Outerspace.  Downside there are no beltloops or waist tie- full dependence on the elastic.  There are side zippers up the calve, hard to find as they mesh in very well.
review.name: Awesome, but!

review.reviewBody: I run hot, until I start getting cold, then I basically freeze within minutes. Been looking for a warmer light pair of pants for a while but could never seem to find something appropriate. These work like a charm. Used them on a solo backpacking trip recently in the high Sierras, probably down in the mid 20’s at night and these pants were super comfy and warm. Add a base layer and they’d easily work into the teens or lower. Nice work BD!
review.name: Solid warm pants

review.reviewBody: I’m in wet windy cold Patagonia in fjords. Pants are a great layer!
review.name: Patagonia

review.reviewBody: Bought these as they were discounted. Fit just a bit big for me; I'm 5'-9", 145 lbs however they will do fine particularly if I'm wearing long underwear. Haven't worn them in the cold yet but will likely try Everest Base Camp trek again later this year or early 2025 and they should be good for the higher tea-houses.
review.name: Next Trek: EBC

name: Vision Hybrid Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: This hat checks all the boxes. I didn’t see the reflective parts when I bought it but that is a huge bonus for my road runs.
review.name: Great for all runs

review.reviewBody: Awesome hat! Comfortable and my husband noticed when we were hiking at night that the hat has reflective strips! Great for safety at night
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Light wieght and looks good, you can wear all day long
review.name: Good for any dress

review.reviewBody: The cap fit as expected and is a great addition to my summer hiking gear.
review.name: Quality Cap

review.reviewBody: Awesome hat for activities. Large mesh allows for more airflow and the flexible brim allows you to stash it in the pack and not worry about it getting bent. I lost mine on the second day of owning it while paddle boarding🥹
review.name: Great for activities!

review.reviewBody: So light, breathable, and comfortable. The best lightweight summer hat for all things outdoors. I've already camped, fished, and run with the hat. Love the flexibility and weight of the brim, not too flimsy, and not too firm.... juuuust right!
review.name: For a guy with a lot of hats... this is my new fav

review.reviewBody: A great multi-use hat for being super lightweight, breathable, and packable. I mainly use it for trail running. Great for dunking in a stream and wearing for an immediate cooldown.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Elite Borson Bike Travel Bag online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I could write not a whole paragraph but a whole chapter on how horrible this bag is. The highlights, the bag has plastic parts that are not durable and crack easily, the bag fabric has no support which makes it feel like it's just a swimming suit fabric wrapped over the bike, the plastic disc covers for wheels don't fit 12mm endcaps (and slide off) but only quick release instead and trying to fit them on 12mm endcaps could only result in damages. The rear axle is "secured" to the bag base by a velcro which is too short and does not hold the bike well. Once the bike is placed inside the bag, you can literally grab it by the seatpost or the headtube for example how soft and non-protective the fabric is, anything other than gentle handling is likely to cause some damages to the bike. I have traveled with this bag once and never again. Not worth the money, not worth the frustration.
review.name: The worst bike bag I've purchased

review.reviewBody:
So my first concern with travel bags or boxes is safety of my bike. The padding did a great job protecting the frame and handlebars. The rail system that the bike attaches to is very firm, holds it in place. Even with a large 60cm frame road bike I did not have to remove the handlebars or the rear derailleur. There is room in the bottom for bike bag, helmet, and or shoes, but no good way to secure them unless you have a way to affix to your frame. The wheels in their own own padded bags provide side protection. Weighed in at 49 lbs, but size was too big for Southwest, so it was an extra $75 each way of my flight. 2 flights so far, and everything was perfect. Aside from removing the wheels, the only other thing I had to do was lower the seat. High marks for an easy to maneuver and light weight solution!
TSA did undo the inner strap, put the wheel bag back in upside down with the strap loose, but The bike still arrived safely.
review.name: Light, protective, easy to travel with

name: Borson Bike Travel Bag

review.reviewBody: Great for work, only complaint is the laces are a bit long. I hope they make something in this range with some more ankle support in the future.
review.name: Good everyday shoe

review.reviewBody:
They are sooooo comfy.
I tryied them in store but they didn't have my number,  so I decided to get them on-line, lucky enough that they were even more discounted now. I work on my feet everyday for 8 hours, and these had passed the test. They feel so comfortable, enough room for my toes and the insole its amazing. I might get them in more colours in the future.
review.name: Good soup

review.reviewBody: Absolute sensational runner for casual or active wearing
review.name: Vans MTE ultra orange

review.reviewBody: My second pair. Super comfortable and lightweight.
review.name: Best Shoes Ever

review.reviewBody: These shoes are amazingly comfortable and functional
review.name: Vans MTE Ultra

review.reviewBody: We were shopping for our Grandson's.  He knew what he wanted as soon as he saw the style of the MTE Ultra Range Neo VR3 Black.  I must admit he's got good taste for an 11 yr old.  He's very happy.  Thankyou.
review.name: Making our Grandson's Day

review.reviewBody:
I suffer from relatively mild plantar fasciitis heel pain which increases with the wrong shoes. I should mention that it is these Neo VR3's specifically that have excellent stability as some of the other models don't have great stability. 


I have literally tried everything including obviously orthotics (which don't really work for me). Over the past year or two I have probably been through 10 different shoe brands to try and find one that looked cool, was comfortable and relieved my heel pain (including specialist brands). This is the best one I have found to fit my requirements. It is also great you do a version that is water resistant and even more cushioned which I will be purchasing for winter (here Australia as it rains a lot). 

Would highly recommend. I will be getting several more pairs. I work as a designer so can wear fairly casual shoes at work -I still like them to look good as I care about my appearance though- so these are awesome for me in general.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody:
Super comfy 
I use them for climbing at work

Would love vans to make composite toe shoes
really comfy, they look good and they seem well-made so far. only downside is they're really white! i'm worried about getting them dirty 😅
review.name: good purches

review.reviewBody: This is literally the most comfortable and beautiful shoes in the world
review.name: Awesome

name: Ultrarange Neo VR3 Shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Neutrino 200 Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Neutrino 200 Sleeping Bag: 30F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Neutrino 200 Sleeping Bag: 30F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this sleeping bag for summer multi day hiking. Was also hoping to get some use out of it in early autumn. It's is pretty much useless...it does not keep you warm. Night time temperature of 10 degrees and I'm cold in this bag even on a really good thermarest neoair sleeping pad. So disappointing.
review.name: very disappointing

review.reviewBody:
I have used this sleeping bag during the summer. As with all Rab products, it is beautifully made and the Pertex is a great lightweight fabric. Many have said that they felt cold in this bag but I found if I cacooned myself inside the bag with the hood up, I was toasty, but equally on a particularly warm night, I could unzip and throw a bit of leg out to cool down. The bag packs down to a small size and was easy to pack away in my backpack. I would be cautious about using this bag in early spring or late autumn - and definitely nowhere near colder weather. However, I guess if you use it with a thermal liner, that would extend its range, but I haven't tried that yet. Buy this if you are camping in the summer and want a beautiful and super comfortable lightweight bag. I used this bag with a Sea to Summit Ultralight insulated sleeping mat. Look after this bag and it will most likely last you a lifetime - I still have a 1000g winter Rab down bag which is more than 20 years old and still in great condition. If it's down you want, then it has to be Rab !
PS. I am a fairly slim 165 cm female and my Neutrino 200 is the regular men's bag.
review.name: Great lightweight summer bag

review.reviewBody:
It’s mainly being used for bike packing and as it packs down small and is light it’s fantastic.
It’s also warm enough for late spring early autumn and because it has a long zip it’s good for summer.
review.name: It’s mainly being used for

review.reviewBody: I already have a Neutrino 400, and wanted a lighter weight bag for summer trips and bike packing. This item that purpose perfectly. It's super light, compresses really small, and is perfect warmth for a summer trip. I've used it for a couple of weekends already and has been comfortable and warm enough for mild spring nights. I'd love a ladies version (i.e. slightly shorter) but this longer length isn't a problem for me. I love the new storage sacks too.
review.name: Fantastic lightweight sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: The sleeping bag looks and feels lovely, and excellent quality, but unfortunately it did not keep me warm despite using a good quality sleeping mat, wearing merino base layers, wooly socks, a down jacket and hat for bed. I was still cold when it was 7 degrees at night when camping in Exmoor and reluctant to use it again unless it’s a warm summer night. Next time I would go for a 300, not this 200.
review.name: For warm summer only

review.reviewBody: Very excited by this well-made bag. Exercise caution at the claims made by manufacturer. Not safe for freezing temperatures. I'm just back from camping in Black Mountains in Wales where it reached a modest 7 degrees at night. I was very cold in this bag and had to wear long johns, socks, multiple woollen layers and a down jacket to stop from shivering. Disappointed by its performance although it is still good quality construction and I will use it for warmer camping in the summer. I have a heavier Rab bag that has never let me done, but it weighs 1.6kg.
review.name: Lightweight sleeping bag, but only for summer

name: Neutrino 200 Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.reviewBody: I knew I had to have it the moment I laid eyes on it. Once I found it in my favorite colorways, I just had to! Absolutely in love with a simple positive message.
review.name: Love at first sight

review.reviewBody: Wear it all the time, for hikes, exploring the city and walking my dogs.
review.name: My favorite hat

review.reviewBody: I have a few things from Cotopaxi and I cannot say enough about this brand. Everything is made to last, and it withstands wear and tear from all my outdoor activities. The do good 5 panel hat has gotten me so many compliments and is so flattering! Do good!!
review.name: Talia- Hat

review.reviewBody:
This Cotopaxi Do-Good 5-Panel Hat is an amazing product! I cannot recommend it enough. It is not only stylish and comfortable, but it is also made from sustainable materials and ethically constructed.

I especially love the multiple colors of the hat. I love this hat so much that I wear it all the time, and I always get compliments on it. People always ask me where I got it, and I'm always happy to tell them about Cotopaxi and their commitment to sustainability.
review.name: New Favorite Hat

review.reviewBody: Great hat to have. Love the words that go with the hat.
review.name: Do Good hat

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wanting this hat for a while and finally decided to get it. It was worth the wait and I love it just as much as I thought. The fit is great and has been great for day use and hiking. Plus, shipping was extremely fast from the site. 10/10 recommend this hat and brand
review.name: Worth the wait

review.reviewBody: Love the products. I think it would be worthwhile to print “do good” in Spanish, French or Pali. Pali is a language used by Buddhists. John Dooley
review.name: Do good hat and shirt

review.reviewBody: Super nice! Better than the vast majority of caps on the market. It is the only hat my son wears.
review.name: 5 Panel Hat

review.reviewBody: This hat is great! Cute and comfortable, fits well!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I have a small head and well fitted hats are hard to find. I love this hat and want to buy more in different colors!
review.name: My new fave

name: Do Good 5-Panel Hat

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Evac Compression Dry Bag online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They are perfect for backpacking hiking! Love that air can be squeezed out the bottom while bag is being folded at the top for closure. I wish all our Sea to Summit dry bags are Evac.
review.name: We love Evac compression bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have 2; These bags work great for my down camping quilt and also my clothes. Keeps my essentials dry and small.
review.name: E-Vent compression dry bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Work like a regular compression sack but don’t have to worry about them getting wet.
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Keeping my gear dry when kayaking can be a challenge, these bags keep my sleeping bag dry and compressible.
review.name: Meets the needs of dryness and compression

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome compression dry bag. Love the vent material on bottom, allows for more compression. Looks awesome, easy to lug around and light. Perfect compression dry bag.
review.name: Perfect Compression Dry Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Spent a month backpacking through New Zealand, and with all the rain, this compression dry bag was perfect for my sleeping bag! Took it through multiple days of non-stop rain and held up well. Ended up buying two! Strapped it right outside my back. Would highly recommend to anyone!
review.name: One month backpacking in New Zealand

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is awesome! Packs up my 32/50 degree bag no problem. Super confident in dryness
review.name: This bag is awesome! Packs

review.reviewBody: I posted a review when I received the bag in April. Now i have field tests to pass along. The buckles are very well designed and held up well with hiking trails, constant open and closing. The only thing i see that can be improved is the bottom band needs a clip loop or carabiner spot so it can be solely held in one spot. I hike and clip it to the outside of my pack and noticed after five hikes (10miles each) the bag loop was coming apart from sliding back and fourth on my pack as I hike. It has not came apart but may if I continued to carry it that way. Now i stuff it inside my pack to prevent damage. The sack has not failed in the dry storage performance. Nothing to improve there. The quality has outperformed some other brands i have used in the past. Thank you to Sea to Summit for making gear that works.
review.name: Tested and passed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought the 6-quart and 10-quart compression bags, using the smaller for underwear and socks, and the larger for other clothes. They make a huge difference on the size of my backpack/suitcase. Easy to close and open. I plan to buy another 10-quart, maybe two.
review.name: I bought the 6-quart and

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used this bag on a 12 day backpacking trip. I kept my clothing in it and was hoping to keep everything dry. We were stuck in 3 thunderstorms and it did as expected. Also worked great as a pillow to reduce pack weight.
review.name: Great dry bag

name: Evac Compression Dry Bag

description: Buy the Sterling PowerCord Cordelette - 5.9mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PowerCord Cordelette - 5.9mm
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sterling PowerCord Cordelette - 5.9mm online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this per recommendation from a professional guide for our Toprope anchor building class. Planning on using it to build secure anchors for toprope sessions and fully trust that it'll hold! A little stiff now, but the guide said it'll loosen up with further use
review.name: Great Cordelette

review.reviewBody:
About to retire this after 5+ years of use for trad multi-pitch climbing.  I am planning to buy a new one.   This is always my go-to cordelette for anchors.   Its light, thin and very strong.  Take up noticeably less space on my rack than other ropes.

It is definitely stiffer than my other anchor ropes, but it has never been an issue.  Used it for quad self-equalizing anchors, figure eight pre-equalized anchors, and occasionally a sliding x without the stiffness being an issue.

Highly recommend!
review.name: Best cordelette for anchors!

review.reviewBody: My climbing buddy was skeptical due to its size but wow, it's incredibly strong and super stiff. It's always on my harness for anchor building. Bomber is an understatment.
review.name: Excellent Cord for a Quad Anchor

name: PowerCord Cordelette - 5.9mm

description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components ReMote online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: ReMote
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components ReMote online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: In case you were wondering what the limited edition purple lever looks like here it is. I got this to replace my stock lever and I will never go back. I've used a handful of different dropper levers and this is my favorite by far. It's also super helpful that there are so many different mounting options available. It's well machined and reliable. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Drop it like it's HOT

review.reviewBody: This was the first really solid dropper lever anyone released. Since then other great options have popped up, but most of them have borrowed some or all of this Wolftooth design. It's made in the US, works flawlessly, and looks sick. It's iconic at this point.
review.name: The original and still the best

name: ReMote

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Second day wearing them. I bought a half size larger because I use them all day and I'm on my feet.  I find them still very tight and hurting my toes

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfort and fit and grip are all good, but giving this 3 stars as the build quality is lacking. I have only put around 200KMs on these, and already some of the waterproofing on the seams around the sole is starting to let go, and the black tab at the top of the shoe that the lace goes through is pulling off.  Have predominately used these for moderate hikes, nothing extreme.
review.name: Good comfort, not great quality
comment: We'd love the opportunity to help at 800-288-3124.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. I walk about 30 miles a week. Previous to owning these shoes my big toe on my right foot would always get sore when I walked, not anymore! Merrell really makes the best shoes in my opinion.
review.name: Great Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These are the best pair of Merrell shoes I have bought so far. Nice sole,nice upper,laces stay tied and are a perfect length this time. They are a little snug like was listed in the description. 
-Great shoes.
review.name: Best pair of Merrell shoes yet.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These seem over sized for me. Too much wiggle room even with my custom orthotic.
review.name: Still breaking in
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have them on now at work they are light and worth the money
review.name: Worth the money

name: Moab Speed 2 GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are durable, ergonomic, light, and good-looking.  Pretty much the perfect sport draw, unless you're doing long multi-pitch routes where you'd want something ultralight with dyneema.  That being said I will still probably use these at chico potrero.  It is worth noting that buying the six pack vs buying individual will yield slightly different products.  With the six pack, each draw has the DMM logo sewn onto one side of the dogbone, whereas the individually sold units do not.  The blue portion of the straight gate biner is also a slightly different color, although I'd chock that up to likely a difference in production batch.
review.name: My favourite quick draw

description: Buy the Ocean Kayak Malibu Two XL Tandem Kayak - 2023 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Malibu Two XL Tandem Kayak - 2023
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ocean Kayak Malibu Two XL Tandem Kayak - 2023 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Malibu Two XL Tandem Kayak - 2023
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ocean Kayak Malibu Two XL Tandem Kayak - 2023 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: We had an Ocean Malibu for 28 years. It was great but finally cracked in half after sitting in full sun on water (tied to dock between uses) all day each summer. Took plenty of use and abuse from kids. So we bought another Ocean kayak to replace it only went larger as we often wanted to squeeze 3 on the Malibu ( and did, but not comfortably). The Malibu xl looks and feels significantly bigger, is much more stable side to side, hard to tip. Has nice waterproof storage wells, good from and back storage for towels under crisscrossed bungees. It’s heavier but we don’t care cuz we only carry it twice a year, to put in and out of water and still not too heavy for two people to carry. The only negative is that I wish the seat backs would stay up (the are hinged). One can be made to stay up with the hooked black bungees on back of it, the other we had to get some rope and tie it back to the side handles. Nice seaglass color.
review.name: Nice, solid kayak, plenty of room for 3

name: Malibu Two XL Tandem Kayak - 2023

review.reviewBody: This is more of a cool weather glove not a cold weather glove. There is no insulation on the palm so the cold comes right through the metal bars. However this is a better option when you know it's going to be cool crisp and windy during those shoulder season rides.  The fit is a little off from my other two Fox gloves of the same size. These fingers are  tad longer and the touchpad only works so-so. The wrist opening needs to be larger with a pull loop. Kudos to the designer on not adding a long wrist cuff like so many others do, which will cause a conflict between long sleeves, fitness trackers, etc. not to mention heat ventilation around the wrists. If they added some padding to the palm and made the fit more consistent with the summer gloves this would be five stars.
review.name: Good but not great

name: Defend Lo-Pro Fire Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great carry on bag. Very stylish and more room than you think. I used this bag for a 2 day trip to Ireland and it held everything I needed. I took two pairs of pants, two shirts and my toiletries. There was still room in the front pockets for electronics and documents. Great go bag
review.name: Great carry on bag. Very

review.reviewBody: I used this to fly from Boston to Lumembourg and it was very convenient. Easy to carry with shoulder strap on it’s own or easy to slide over the handle (rails) of my Transporter rolling suitcase. It’s a smaller bag but I managed to get everything I needed in it, including extra clothes in case I had to check my rolling bag and it got lost. I loved the sleek design and like my other Osprey bags, it seems well made and durable. I paid full price, and am still totally happy with it for the money.
review.name: Excellent carry on bag!

name: Ozone CarryOn Boarding Bag

review.reviewBody: this is a great addition to our camping gear and easy to find with the bright handle
review.name: great addition to our camping gear

review.reviewBody: I just received this knife to replace an old camp kitchen knife with bad steel and handle. This MSR knife arrived sharp and feels very light. I may dedicate to backpacking rather than all purpose camp kitchen tub.
review.name: Nice lightweight kitchen knife

review.reviewBody: Very sharp and light. Perfect size. Great for chopping food car camping or in the backcountry. Better than my hunting knife for sure LoL!
review.name: Sharp and light. Perfect size.

review.reviewBody: This knife is wicked sharp, and I love the sleeve to protect the blade. Handle is a durable material, in the knife feels like it'll hold up. It's worked on both backcountry trips, and front country guacamole expeditions
review.name: Great knife

review.reviewBody: These knives are great. Nice and light,sharp, great for spreading. Love it
review.name: Excellent little knife

review.reviewBody: Sharp knives. Hold and edge well. Would buy again.
review.name: Good knives.

review.reviewBody: These knives are my goto knives for traveling. I like that they have a sheath for safety and to protect the edge.
review.name: Recommend for travel, backpacking, etc.

review.reviewBody: I finally purchased a real knife for the camp kitchen. It will be very nice not to use the leatherman for everything. This knife is well-made and very light. I keep this knife in my kitchen drawer at home and use it often. It is sharp and has a good blade.
review.name: Great Knife

review.reviewBody: I bought this knife for my Dad a year ago before a camp trip --- it has now turned into an everyday knife! It's super sharp, durable and lightweight enough to pack it anywhere. I definitely recommend!
review.name: Super Sharp

review.reviewBody: Been using this knife for over 6 years in my mess kit. Cuts well, sharpens easy, cleans easy, and dries off fast (nice sheath). What more could you want?
review.name: Workhorse

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband who hikes the NH 4000 footers.  He's worn them a few times, and they stay up, keep the snow out and are very light weight.
review.name: They do the job.

review.reviewBody: These are great multipurpose gaiters for any season
review.name: Lightweight, Durable, Packable

review.reviewBody: I wear them regularly all winter. Wore med size because the leg height was spot on only issue the foot strap needs 2 more holes longer so they fit over my boots in the right place for the hook loop. This time i went with the large. I am 6'2" size 11 boots They are so tall they fasten at the knee, rubs the back of the knee, about 2" too long to be worn comfortably, but they fit nicely over my boots.
review.name: Good gaiters

review.reviewBody: I have bought a number of different gaiters over the years and these are the best ones I've found. Well-designed, lightweight, easy to put on, I really like the system for keeping then snug around your calves, etc. Really the best ones around.
review.name: Best gaiters available

review.reviewBody: Used them for a few hours a day in the Montana winter for a couple of days. They worked well and kept the snow out of my boots while also protecting my pants from twigs and branches. I recommend water-proofing them with a waterproofing spray before using them for snow. Wearing baggier pants also helps them stay up better if you cinch them tight just below the knee.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: Currently using these for winter fat biking. Do a great job biking and keep my dry when pushing through deep snow. I'm sure they will work all seasons.
review.name: Do the job

review.reviewBody: These work perfect and are not that heavy do not weigh you down at all and work wonders! Super happy
review.name: Totally awesome

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my everyday winter hiking and snowshoeing and it kept my leg dry for the whole activity. very easy to put on, stay unmoved and lightweight.
review.name: A must have item for those who like activities in the snow

review.reviewBody: Great gaiters! Well fitting to my boots, great quality! Great for wet hiking, keep feet dry and warm.
review.name: Kept me dry in knee deep mud!

review.reviewBody: I used these for a backcountry elk hunt in Colorado. There was a foot of snow on the ground and these gaiters kept my pants and boots completely dry. I would highly recommend these. They work great and are very affordable
review.name: Great Gaiters!

name: Rocky Mountain High Gaiters

review.reviewBody: I have worn Garneau shorts for 10 years and they fit me better than any other brand.  They also last a long time if washed and air dried.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Great fit

review.itemreviewed: CB Neo Power RTR Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love a good quality short and these were not that.  Returning today. Fabric seemed like a gym short not a cycling short that would be supportive. Also the pad was really stiff. I typically wear Castelli and Assos and gave this brand a try.
review.name: I found the fabric to be sub standard

review.itemreviewed: CB Neo Power RTR Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: Loved them the first 20 rides. Super soft padding. Then, the leg material started to roll up my leg while riding. I don?t put them in the dryer. I don?t have this problem with any other shorts. So disappointed.
review.name: Legs roll up

review.itemreviewed: CB Neo Power RTR Short - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife, who has recently gotten into mountain biking and the first ride out was an adjustmemt to get used to the fit and feel. The padding is in all the right spots and worked great for her. She said they do fit a little small like other reviews warned but it helps to have them more snug then big cause of the padding.
review.name: They work great!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've had these boots for a month, and while I was a little nervous about the 200g rating instead of the 400g rating of the boots they replaced, they've been warm down to single digits with a good pair of socks. They seem to run a tiny bit big compared to my summer boots, but that space can be offset with an extra pair of socks. I chose to select true-to-size because I think having a little extra room in the toe box in winter is better than not. The boots are very comfortable, have excellent traction with the Vibram sole and aggressive tread pattern, and show little wear. I haven't been a Merrell boot enthusiast, but these have changed my mind!
review.name: Warm, lightweight, and no break in!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very light, comfortable and excellent on snow and icy terrain. The warmth level is appropriate for cold weather. The only dow side is i wish it was a higher boot to prevent snow and debris from coming in the shoe.
review.name: Comfortable, lightweight, functional

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the best shoes I have ever worn.  Comfortable, support, and tread.
review.name: The BEST
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been trying to find good 'intermediate' boots for snowshoeing for over a year. I bought several pairs and returned them all. These are exactly what I was looking for. They are waterproof, warm, and have stiff enough uppers for cinching down snowshoe bindings. They also have great tread and decent edging ability on hard, steep snow when not using snowshoes. They're much lighter and less expensive than technical mountaineering boots, which were the only other good option I could find.
review.name: Great winter boot for snowy treks
comment: Thank you for the excellent review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have a pair of Merrells from the late eighties...These are just as good but extremely lighter. I always buy Merrell
review.name: New Merrill's replace my 35 year old pair!
comment: Thank you for sharing your great feedback with us!

These boots are comfortable & good for Fall & Winter!
I wear mine a lot & no pain whatsoever!
review.name: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid Waterproof
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been a fan of Merrell for years but in the past few years have needed a wider toebox due to foot issues and swelling..which led me to having to wear another brand. I REALLY loved my Merrells so I took a chance on these and even ordered my normal size with fingers crossed, a hope and a prayer. Usually I read reviews saying to size up on the boots/shoes and have sized up once. I am so happy to say these fit with PLENTY of room! I will even be able to wear my winter socks with them! They also stay in place(no slipping around in the heel area)! Do not hesitate to buy these! I would say they do fit true to size with room to spare for thicker socks as well. I am actually wearing mine on and off now with regular socks and also with regular socks and my compression socks together and still good fit. I hope this helps. Finally I have a PRETTY pair of winter boots instead of the black ones I got from another brand. I do have to say..I wish Merrell would continue to come out with all the fun colors(think pink, fuschia, purples, blues, etc) and keep them in stock. There is another pair I want to get for me and my daughter both but we BOTH want the bright pink pair..and it is always sold out or not even on website anymore..yet we see the pictures of them in reviews(they are the Women's Antora 3 Mid Waterproof) PLEASE bring the Knockout Pink color back!!! Love these that I got tho and am looking forward to wearing them all winter!
review.name: Finally a roomy fit!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Mine are worn volunteering at the Detroit Zoo. I get between 4- 6 miles a shift. First day was rough, added an orthotic (wear orthotics with all my shoes) and no more issues! My feet feel good, my ankles are supported. Yay!
review.name: love these boots

name: Moab Speed 2 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Aether Plus 60L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used this pack to complete 120 miles and 38K vertical feet for the Annapurna Circuit high altitude trek through the Himalayas. It was my amazing constant companion. Living out of a backpack for multiple weeks will bring out the best and the worst and I can’t find a single complaint with the pack. I could nitpick a bit, sure, but I’ve never had a pack come even close to this one in thoughtful details, overall design, customized fit, and the big one - comfort! You’re never going to forget the weight is there, but this pack was so comfortable that during breaks I often just left it on. Wouldn’t consider going with another brand now. The lid doubling as a (actually robust) daypack was key! My friends were jealous of that feature. Amazing backpack and the Osprey system is just so top notch! Thanks, Osprey!!
review.name: Perfect Pack!!

name: Aether Plus 60L Backpack

description: Buy the Black Diamond Mission Tent: 3-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mission Tent: 3-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Mission Tent: 3-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The mission 3P has a bunch of well thought out features that makes it the best expedition base camp weight tent that I’ve used. First for pitching, all of the poles clip on from the outside, making getting it up really, really fast. Second, it’s a spacious 3P tent. We had plenty of room for 3P to be comfy throughout a trip to Denali, and could have squeezed 4 people in if it was needed. 

The internal pockets are well sized and spaced. I always add a mesh net or cord to the ceiling of tents for drying gear, this tent has ample attachment points. Each anchor point had a long cord attached that was plenty long to girth hitch snow stakes and also t-slot them. Bonus points for all of the guy lines being attached with a bowline and nicely coiled when the tent arrived. That made setup and prep needs before the first use virtually nonexistent.
review.name: Simply awesome!

review.reviewBody:
I spent 45 nights over 4 expeditions on the Alsek River in this tent, and it has missed the mark in a couple of key spots. It is very spacious, I would say it is the size of a typical 4 person tent. It keeps the glacial dust out, and it is quieter than other tents when the wind really picks up. If the body is left in, it sets up in the wind and rain nicely. 

The 2 big issues I have with this tent:

-Zippers are too small to deal with the glacial flour, dust, and sand. It only took a little bit of frost to cause issues. They frequently jammed up, and they will not last long. 

-The ground sheet is terrible. Taking the tent down in the rain is pretty slick. The way the body comes out makes it easy to keep the body dry in a downpour when you are taking the tent down. But putting it up with the body removed, pray for now wind, and no rain. If the ground sheet used the same clips as the body to clip into the fly at the base of the poles (reversed sex so they don’t get mix up) rather than the stupid elastics, it would be a total game changer. If I have to use this tent for another season, I will see them in myself to avoid the hassles I had this summer. 

If they make those 2 changes for next year, awesome tent, and your should buy. If they don’t, buy a Trango
review.name: Almost a great tent

review.reviewBody: Very good tent for hard conditions and comfortable for 3 people. Good vestibule in both sides. Easy to set up one difficult weather but difficult tu spread the part to carry it between the crew
review.name: Strong and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super spacious tent. Used as a luxury 2 person. We were confident we could fit 4 in the even of a tent malfunction in our party. Could be lighter
review.name: Spacious and Warm

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the best tent I have ever owned. Easy to assemble. Spacious and sturdy. A wee weighty for a trail hike, but otherwise awesome.
review.name: Mission 3 P tent

review.reviewBody:
Bought this tent when there were ZERO reviews online, so it was a leap of faith.

Great decision. It's 10 lb so not an ultralight. But it's a great design, strong material, and incredibly easy to setup. Very happy with the purchase.
review.name: What a great tent

review.reviewBody:
The medium sized 3P is an excellent compromise size that can be used as a 2 person palace or a cramped 4 person home. I love that the fly is attached to the tent body so when I take it out in a downpour the interior of the tent stays dry. You stake the four corners of the rectangular floor, then assemble the poles into the structural frame before you raise the tent to attach. All these features make pitching a Mission tent in high winds and torrential rains a pleasure… at least in comparison to other tents. Love all the interior attachment points… I think I counted around 20. I’ve always had one vestibule with previous tents but having two equally sized vestibules and doors made getting in and out of the tent much easier and made it easy to keep equipment off the tent floor. 

This is listed as a 4 season tent but this tent would be tough to use in hot weather. The only ventilation to the tent body is from bug netting on the top 1/3 of each door (which I don’t recall seeing in descriptions or photos). And of course the fly extends basically to the ground. This is a no-compromise cool or cold weather tent, more so than previous 4 season tents I’ve used which had full netting doors. You’ll need a different tent for summer, but the lack of compromise make it extra nice in cool or cold weather. 

I wasn’t excited about the monotone blue color of the fly but it’s nicer in person than the photos. I will probably replace the black guy lines with bright orange line which will complement the blue nicely and make them easier to see. The tent body is white which is nice, but everything and everyone inside is going to look blue anyway. I like my yellow tents, but mostly I don’t spend a lot of time in the tent during the day. If I had to be in a tent all day as part of a base camp I suppose blue would be easier to live with.

Finally, looking at the BD videos on the tent I was a bit concerned about how the fabric was flapping in the light winds. I have a Fitzroy single wall which has drum tight walls, and other 4 season tents I’ve use are a lot more taught than the videos of the Mission tents. In person though it’s clearly not a problem. There are a lot of guy lines. It’s never going to be like the single wall Fitzroy, but you can make it much better than the videos.

I really like the Fitzroy and an old VE-25 I used to have, but this Mission 3P is my new favorite tent for cool or cold weather.
review.name: My new favorite tent

name: Mission Tent: 3-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody:
The Malone jacket. in my opinion, is the most comfortable and best backcountry jacket Flylow has. Due to its stretchy material, it is easy to pack, incredibly comfortable to wear, it resists tears, and breathability is awesome.
Overall, if you are looking for a comfy yet durable jacket, definitely go for the Malone. I've used it for over 100 days in the US and 60+ days in south America, and it still has no rips or zipper failure.
